Description: Neck and mouth sherd of Milesian pre- Fikellura pottery trefoil oinochoe; white slip; exterior: black on lip; trace of an eye in white; on neck, moulded ridge at junction of lip; double addorsed frieze of painted lotus buds and lotus flowers (with added purple on central petal) between dividing bands consisting of dots and billet pattern.
Curator's comments: Sherd joins British Museum 1924,1201.922 and probably belongs to British Museum 1924,1201.921. (CVA BM 8, pl. 9 no. 2 and Walter-Karydi 1973, pl. 2, 24 show 1924,1201.922 still joined to 1886,0401.1051). The addorsed flowers are part of the evidence for the dating of this oinochoe.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (9, no. 2)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (115, no. 24)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 248, no. 6)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. VII, no. 14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.161)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 145-6, Nau 112, pl. 24e-g)
